page.title: 01LANDSCAPE AROUND CHAPEL'TH
page.content: Chapel-en-le-Frith is a rural district linked by the A6 & a railway to Buxton & Manchester. The town(pop.7760) lies south of the gritstone edge of Combs Moss,but east the area rises to the limestone plateau & the community of Dove Holes(pop 960). Chapel'th grew around the church and market place and is now expanding rapidly.Dove Holes is a linear village developed in the l9th century around the quarry industry.The village of Combs consists of farms,cottages & some new houses but is entirely rural in character. Many people are still employed in farm ing & quarry-related industries but light-engineering,transport & metal fabrication also contribute. The major employer is Ferodo Ltd.,producers of friction materials.
